ICYMI the #CARESAct that passed the House Friday provides:

✅ Direct cash payments to most Americans

✅Relief for small businesses

✅Expanded unemployment benefits including gig and freelance workers

✅Incentives for businesses to keep their employees on payroll

If you depend on Social Security and have questions about direct payments in the #CARESAct, please read this helpful information provided by @WaysMeansCmte.

https://t.co/EOLh1FnOKD
We all have a role to play in helping stop the spread of coronavirus. Please #StayHomeforNevada.

The relief bill we passed yesterday provides $200 billion for hospitals, health systems, and health research. That includes new funding for personal protective equipment used by health care workers on the frontlines.

We know our gratitude isn't enough. They need more PPE.

Travel & tourism support 367,000 jobs in Southern Nevada. Our #FamiliesFirst relief bill helps keep more workers on payroll with the Employee Retention Tax Credit. It supports restaurants, retailers, and resorts with increased access to loans. Airports will get $10b in grants.

The coronavirus relief bill we just passed will provide direct cash payments of $1,200 to every adult with a Social Security Number who makes under $75,000/year and $500 for every child. That's just one way we're putting #FamiliesFirst.

The coronavirus relief bill we just passed will expand unemployment benefits by providing:
 
- An additional $600/week for four months

- 13 more weeks of federal benefits once you've exhausted your state benefits

- Eligibility for gig economy workers and the self-employed

We need an enormous recovery package to bring relief to families, workers, and small businesses – and that is exactly what the House just passed. So many families in Southern Nevada are struggling right now and I want them to know that some help is on the way.

So many families in Southern Nevada are struggling right now to pay rent and feed their children. 

I want them to know that this recovery package was put together with them in mind. 

Las Vegas is a resilient city. We’ve proven that before and we will prove it once again. https://t.co/r1QZ39NzPs
